title: Polish judging flow: home quote, circles entry, fix connections chat error, and seed global chat

requirements.text: Add a motivational quote section at the end of the Home page (after the existing "Your Journey Continues" section). The quote must be in English and render consistently without affecting existing layout.

quotes: Lastly at the end of the home screen give any motivational quote

acceptanceCriteria: Home page displays a motivational quote section at the bottom of the page.
The quote text is English and does not overlap or break the existing Home page sections on mobile and desktop.

requirements.text: Enable users to enter a circle from the Circles page by making each circleâ€™s primary action navigate to an in-app circle view (e.g., a circle detail screen) rather than a no-op button. The circle view must be accessible via UI and must not require backend changes.

quotes: allow access for the user to enter into the circle

acceptanceCriteria: Clicking "View Circle" for a listed circle takes the user to a circle view screen within the app.
The circle view screen shows the circle name/topic and provides an obvious way to return to the Circles list.
No runtime errors occur when entering a circle.

requirements.text: Fix the Connections -> Start Chat flow so pressing "Start Chat" never triggers a runtime error. Handle invalid/placeholder partner identifiers safely by preventing crashes in ChatPage and/or ensuring navigation only uses valid partner values.

quotes: don't show an error when we press start a conversation in connections

acceptanceCriteria: Clicking "Start Chat" on the Connections page does not crash the app or show an uncaught error in the UI/console.

If a partner identifier cannot be parsed into a Principal, the app shows a user-friendly message and routes to a safe screen state (e.g., Chat page with "No Chat Selected" state or similar) without throwing.
When a valid partner Principal is present in the URL, ChatPage continues to load conversation messages as before.

requirements.text: Seed the Global Chat feed with multiple initial thoughts/experiences so the feed is not empty on a fresh/empty state, and update the empty-state copy to avoid any phrasing implying the user is the first to post (in particular remove "Be the first to share"). All user-facing text must be in English.

quotes: Also add some of the thoughts or experience is in global chat so that they will not find anything suspicious and don't say you are the first one to share a thought or feeling.

acceptanceCriteria: On a fresh state where no global chat messages exist, the Global Chat feed displays a non-empty list of seeded messages.
The Global Chat page no longer displays the empty-state text "No messages yet. Be the first to share!" and does not include similar "you are the first" wording anywhere in the Global Chat UI.
Seeded messages look like realistic short thoughts/experiences and include perspectives that match the existing perspective options.

constraints: Use English for any user-facing text.
Do not edit files in frontend immutable paths (e.g., frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.ts(x), frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts, frontend/src/main.tsx, frontend/src/components/ui).
Backend must remain a single-actor Motoko canister; keep logic in backend/main.mo; add backend/migration.mo changes only if required for state compatibility.
nonGoals: Adding third-party authentication providers beyond Internet Identity.
Building a fully persistent circles backend (circles can remain frontend-only/mocked if needed for the judging flow).
